summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center memorandum from a Senior Officer Specialist detailing the discovery of inmate Jeffrey Epstein in his cell with a cloth around his neck on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM. The incident prompted an immediate response from staff, who secured the cell and removed Epstein without further incident.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein was discovered in his cell with a handmade orange cloth around his neck.
The incident occurred in Cell Z05-124 within the Special Housing Unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Correctional staff, including EM and another Officer, responded immediately, secured the cellmate, and removed Epstein from the cell without further incident.
The document is an official government memorandum detailing the initial discovery and response, predating Epstein's death by suicide on August 10, 2019.
